We just got a third instance of this. Needs to be tracked down.

Found the bug. Steps to reproduce involve (but are not so easy):
- have custom background (or foreground color) in Java editor
- move or rename the document in a way that the caret gets moved by the rename
  and that this causes horizontal or vertical scrolling

The bug is as follows: in cases where the editor gets reused (e.g. if reuse is
enabled or a file gets renamed or moved) we call unconfigure() and configure()
on the viewer. We dispose the text widget's foreground and background colors in
JavaSourceViewer.unconfigure() which later during configure() can cause an
exception if the text widget's foreground or background color  is accessed
before it has been set again (in JavaSourceViewer.configure()).

Verified in code of I20050217-2000 that the fix is in place.
